revised_title: Pleistocene Flora of Brandon, Warwickshire: Insights into Middle and Upper Pleistocene Vegetation
tldr: The article examines the flora of middle and upper Pleistocene age from Brandon, Warwickshire, providing insights into the vegetation and plant communities during that time period. The study reveals an open birch woodland influenced by local edaphic conditions, with important aquatic and pioneer associations on sand substrates. The findings suggest delayed immigration of climax species due to the flora's existence during an early interstadial of the Saalian, following the refrigeration that brought the Holstein to a close.
